title: Maximum First Denominator for Egyptian Fraction Representations of 1
overview: Let f(k) = max{n₁ : 1 = 1/n₁ + ... + 1/nₖ with distinct denominators}. Is f(k) = (1+o(1))·k/(e-1)?
conclusion: YES - Croot (2001) proved f(k) ~ k/(e-1). Upper bound is trivial from harmonic series. Lower bound: for any N > 1, there exist distinct n₁ < ... < nₖ in (N, eN] with Σ1/nᵢ = 1.
references: Croot (2001) - Main result: construction in (N, eN]
